name: Mammoth Hot Springs Hotel & Cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because we planned our Yellowstone trip with little notice, we stayed two nights in each of three Yellowstone properties. Our Western Ridge Cabin in the Canyon Village area was the nicest--a large room with two queen beds, table and chairs, good lighting, and decent bathroom with tub. The cabins are arranged in multiple loops in a natural setting, so pay attention if returning after dark.
reviews.title: Our nicest lodging in Yellowstone

likes.liked: — Large, comfortable room tucked in the woods.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Part of the resort had already closed for the season (this was in mid-September) so the one remaining dining room was crowded. One night we ate at the bar rather than endure a long wait; the other night we went early and enjoyed excellent steak (Montana ribeye). The dining room serves a nice breakfast buffet. It's interesting to chat with the pleasant and competent staff all over Yellowstone, most of whom are international college students.
reviews.title: Spartan but enjoyable

likes.liked: — Large, comfortable room tucked in the woods.

reviews.text: First off, it's wonderful to stay anywhere inside Yellowstone, as it makes it easier to see (and hear!) the wildlife that come into open areas at sunset to graze. Staying at Mammoth practically guarantees a show because of the grassy expanses that remain from US Cavalry days. We stayed in a Frontier Cabin, which is fairly small and basic but clean. It had two hard double beds, a small bathroom with a small, formed shower area, and two electric heaters.
reviews.title: good location, mediocre rooms

likes.disliked: — amenities in the room for the price paid

reviews.title: Beautiful area but just a cabin
reviews.text: Dinner at the Mammoth Dining Room was fine, with good service. The bison was chewy but we were advised of this when ordering.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the mamoth hot springs during the labor day weekend.
reviews.title: Large rooms for Yellowstone

reviews.text: stayed for 4 nights and it was great with the BIG exception of the dining room situation. basically, they employ students (cheap/free labour) during the holiday season and as we went mid september, they had all gone home and left the dining room seriously short of staff. we waited a minimum of 30-60 mins both nights we ate there (you cant book). we even waited 30-40 mins for breakfast! the food was pretty average too so we ate elsewhere the other days. the western cabins (go for these!) has had a recent refurb and was good. very powerful heater in the room was well received as it got down to below 0 degrees at night! beds were comfy. walls a little thin. all staff were helpful at all times. good amenities and a great location in the middle of yellowstone park. petrol 1 mins drive off site. i would recommend this place if either you're not fussy about food or dont mind eating elsewhere/buying in. good price for what you get.
reviews.title: Get a western cabin and you'll be fine

reviews.text: While vacationing in Yellowstone we decided to stay at Mammoth at the spur of the moment. Without reservations we had our choice of a mid-range room or a frontier cabin. We chose the room and paid $125 USD which included tax.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The room and bath were spacious and quite charming. There was no shower, but the claw foot tub was relaxing and a nice change of pace. The room and bath were both very clean. There were separate men's and women's showers available.
reviews.title: Quiet in the Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took us about twenty minutes to realize it, but there was no television in the room. That was fine with us. Upon reading about the hotel on their web site after our stay they state, "reflecting the natural surroundings of Yellowstone; televisions, radios, air conditioning, and Internet hook-ups are not available."
reviews.title: Cabins clean and basic

likes.disliked: — It was all ok really, can't complain

reviews.title: Stay somewhere else
reviews.text: The staff were courteous, polite and outgoing. The bellman told us all about our room, gave us directions, and told us about the elk activity during the day.

Stayed in the newer Western Cabins and felt like we got good value for our dollar. The rooms were surprisingly spacious and comfortable. Noise didn't seem to be an issue. We were worried about how clean the rooms would be as we were in the last two weeks of the season. Kudos to the management because our room was spotless. We liked the Canyon's central location because we could take day trips to all the various sections of the Park without lengthly drives. The Cafeteria was closed for the season which limited our dining options. The counter diner was O.K. We did not have particularly good service or food at the Lodge dining room. Because of the higher altitude it was colder and we had more cloud cover than the southern parts of the Park. Had to check out early and cancel our fourth day which we did with no problems. Overall, a great stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was loud and felt old, but not cozy at all. The lobby is small and doesn't invite to sit down. No bar, no service beside a coffee stand.
reviews.title: clean room ,great water pressure, for an excellent price

reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor looking at the parking lot. We heard loud noise from the water pipes or the heating all night. The room had doors to the other rooms and you could hear every word.
reviews.title: Great, comfortable, relaxing lodges with view of nature

likes.liked: — Loacation - Canyon village is perfect lodging since you have same drive to any direction inside the YellowStone Nat'l Park, confy beds, and total privacy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had very low voltage lights, so you couldn't read at night. There was a puddle of water in the room form the heating system. And be aware that the rooms have their own bath, but no shower, only an old bathtub.
reviews.title: Elk plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The night we stayed here a large group had some kind of event and we couldn't sleep until midnight because of loud music and people running up and down the corridors.
reviews.title: Loved hearing the Elk bugling at sunset

likes.disliked: — lack of cell phone and internet signal

reviews.title: Clean and convenient...
reviews.text: First the good stuff - it was clean and conveniently located. The water pressure was great. But, that's about it.

Not that you can expect much. But, the lighting was limited and with an end unit, we actually had windows on three sides. The decor was 50's retro with bedspreads. The door had a normal key lock. With the sink outside the bathroom, it felt very much like a college dormroom.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Bright
In desperate need of modernisation
reviews.text: Worst of all though, was the paper-thin walls. When our neighbors were present, we could hear everything. I almost responded to their conversation.

Part of the reason that we selected Canyon Lodge was that it seemed centrally and conveniently located. That is true. But, with a well-planned trip, I would have preferred to move to another lodge after exploring this area.
reviews.title: 2 Bed Cabin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time in 4 years we stayed here in the Frontier Cabins, and it was nice both times. Only problem has been that there are only double beds; we wish we had queen beds instead. The bathroom was fine, and the room was clean. Good value.
reviews.title: Needs updating and cleaning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our first two Yellowstone nights at the hotel here. It's very simple, economical, and clean. The hotel rooms are small and from a time when travelers didn't expect closets or large bathrooms, but that's the charm of these old National Park accomodations. The staff is friendly, very knowledgable, and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. We were fortunate to have a view from the front and went to sleep with a view of 6 gorgeous elk lying in the grass, silhouetted in the moonlight.
reviews.title: Simple, quaint, and clean

likes.liked: — It was a great beginning to our park stay--clean, quiet.

reviews.title: Pleasently surprised from the cabins
reviews.text: Ok, you might have seen the outside photos of the cabins and read that they were built in the 50ies.
Truth is, that cabins look terribly from outside and as i booked the cheapest category (70$) i was prepared to a lot...
reviews.title: Best Location in the Park

reviews.text: But I also I have read a lot of the comments here and saw the inside pictures: The interior is in a good condition and absolutely clean. They have a good heater, clean carpet, lights, bathroom ammenities, no smell, comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Cozy Cabins

reviews.text: Compared to 45$ for a plain tent with nothing else in yosemite, I also find $70 quite ok.
reviews.title: I can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 1 night in one of the Frontier Cabins at the Mammoth Hot Springs in Yellowstone National Park. The cabins here seemed a bit newer and lots roomier than the one we stayed in at Old Faithful Lodge. The Mammoth Hot Springs cabins are duplexes, side by side units.
reviews.title: Cabins among the Elks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our unit was clean and the heater was really powerful, so we stayed warm and toasty on a cold night.
reviews.title: Cabins are better

likes.liked: — Location. . .nice cabin in the park right in Fort Yellowstone.
likes.disliked: — It wasn't a problem because I booked early but getting a date can be tough. Call early!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a bonus, we no sooner carried our luggage in the door, than we heard an elk bugeling very nearby. We looked out the back door and a herd of elk were grazing on the lawn near the cabins.
reviews.title: Great Cabin at Canyon

likes.disliked: — price was a bit steep, but not too outragious

reviews.text: Be sure to check in the lobby of the lodge for announcements about evening programs. One of the best programs we attended all week was given in the evening by one of the Park employees. The presentation was a very interesting and entertaining account of a family's journey to Yellowstone back in the days when stagecoaches were used to tour the park. It was very well done.
reviews.title: Good experience at Western cabins

reviews.text: The nightmare started when we entered our room. The scenery changes once you take the elevator upstairs. The hallway reminded me of my dorms, very sparsely decorated, minimal carpeting etc....
reviews.title: Take you own Sandwiches!
Very Basic and Outdated, but Comfortable Clean Sleep for the Price
reviews.text: We didn't find our cabin to be dirty. It was outdated in that it was very 50's style, but who cares. Every building can be completely renovated every 20 years. It is a lower priced room and you get what you pay for. There was a great laundry facility nearby and if you go expecting rustic, you shouldn't be disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our visit to YNP this summer, we stayed at 3 different areas - Old Faithful, Tower-Roosevelt, and Canyon. At each area - we had a Frontier cabin with a private bathroom. Of the 3 frontier cabins - the Canyon area cabins were my least favorite. Although clean - they were run down, the window did not close all the way (and it was in the chilly 30 degree temps at night). The interior decor of these cabins really needs refurbishing. the sheets and blankets were clean. The cabin had 2 double beds. The bathroom had a toilet and small shower. The sink was in the sleeping area. The exterior condition is even worse. These cabins are 'adjoined' to each other in quads of 4 and at night we could hear extremely noisy neighbors stampeding into their cabins. The cabins are convenient to the different Canyon area activities and sights. After staying in the cabins at Tower Roosevelt - these in the Canyon area were quite disappointing. The stand-alone cabins in Old Faithful and Tower Roosevelt were in much better condition (inside and out) - all 3 of the cabin areas were about the same price for a Frontier cabin with private bathroom.
reviews.title: Canyon Frontier Cabins - my least favorite of the park's cabins

reviews.text: ..... much as national park accommodation is usually over priced and a bit scruffy this was not bad. The location was mind blowing just adjacent to the terraces. Wildlife in abundance - elks on the lawn, bisons wandering past the restaurant. food in restaurant pretty good, staff very helpful especially in the convenience store. A 1000 times better than Crater Lake staff.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.text: This accommodation is the least expensive within all of Yellowstone that has a private bathroom included. The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us, including two teenaged girls and all of our family's "necessities." We stayed for 11 nights - which is a rather long stay anywhere - and were comfortable the entire time. The beds are comfortable and everything seemed in good working order. The power was out the first night we were there (COLD the next morning!) but as soon as the power was restored, I realized that the furnace was not working properly. The maintenance staff took care of it right away (pilot light was out) and while the temperature of the room was difficult to regulate, the furnace DID warm the room quickly. The only hitch was that we did not get good housekeeping our second-to-last day there, she merely came in and changed towels and made the beds, didn't clean anything. That was a somewhat disappointing end to a great family adventure. I'd stay again, as this is a fairly central location within the park, but I would stay fewer days and probably stay at other locations within the park instead of just one place for an extended time.
reviews.title: Frontier cabin - basic but clean, usually
Don't see the Charm
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in a Western Cabin. Thank goodness we had our 1 ton 4x4 truck as the potholes and the condition of the partly paved/gravel road would had killed my car’s suspension. The Western Cabins are approx. 1 km down a hill from the main office in the middle of the bush. Nothing beautiful, nothing special, just a bunch of actually quite ugly duplexes and quads housing the cabins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first week of June my husband and I spent 2 nights in the clean, roomy Western cabin with 2 comfy queen beds. (cabin P66) Had hair dryer, coffeemaker, large tub with shower, nice big towels and cute bear soap, wall heating unit, fan (didn't have to use) and western knotty pine decor. Cabins were in a nice wooded area...only down side was the road to the cabins needed to have the many potholes filled. The Canyon cabins are in the best area to see wildlife ...only 20 min drive to Hayden Valley and about an hour north to Lamar Valley.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed the Western Cabins

reviews.text: We enjoyed having 2 meals at the Soda Fountain at the Canyon General Store...service was friendly, and the food tasty.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room, what was nice, clean and large.
reviews.title: Frontier cabins adequate, but bring the OFF

reviews.text: I really loved that they are environment friendly: their are recycling bins in the building and one in the room as well.
reviews.title: Reserved for three, stayed only one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no TV, what I really appreciated (not everyone in my family...). There is no fridge, I missed that. Their coffee and tea in the room was really good.
reviews.title: Cozy Clean Cabins, Simple but Good Location

reviews.text: We slept three people in one room and found the rooms to be cramped for three adults. The beds we only a double so we did not get a good nights sleep. There was also no Air conditioning available--but there was a fan provided. Our room was on the second floor which meant lugging our suitcases up a flight of stairs. The rooms we had did look much more modern and equipted than some of the cabins we passed. There were a variety of food choices at the Canyon Village--but they were a short walk or dirve away. No refrigerator.
reviews.title: cramp quarters but much better than a cabin

reviews.text: Other reviewers are right about the temperature of the rooms in the frontier cabins. Because they get full sun during the day they get pretty hot without a/c. But the cool air at night was wonderful. When compared to camping, this is certainly a step up. Potty and shower were in a small separate room with sink out in the bedroom area. Fresh towels were provided daily and linens every fourth day.
reviews.title: Frontier cabins - would stay there again...

reviews.text: In addition to the fan provided, I would bring another from home if I could do it again. I also think a tray table for extra counter space would have been nice. A few lawn chairs to sit in the shade on those sunny afternoons would have been nice. Also, we brought a coffee maker b/c the room did not have one.
reviews.title: Yellowstone Canyon Frontier Cabins embarrassing to US National Parks

reviews.text: These cabins are rustic, but clean and comfortable after a day of sightseeing. Since they are so affordable, I would stay there again,
reviews.title: I would return

reviews.text: We stayed one night June 2011. Two rooms, one for parents, one for son. Our room had a very odd smell. It may have been from the new carpet, but we worried that it was a pesticide. We kept windows open (though the low was about 38º that night) and the furnished desk fan running to keep some fresh air to breathe. The cabin was clean and the mattress was new. As someone else noticed, the sheets are too short for the bed-rather uncomfortable. The shower was very small but worked fine. The view from our area was pretty lame, but no one spends much time in their room at Yellowstone. The furnishings were very dated but everything worked. The main problem with this area is the exterior. The deck that connects the "cabins" have not been sealed often enough and are splintering. The redwood stain on the siding is peeling and unsightly. A large group of Asian tourists came to our area later in the evening and I felt bad that this is what we are offering them. What impression are they getting of the US? Xanterra/Park District needs to do basic maintenance even to rustic accommodations. Our next night was at the Old Faithful Inn. It was not much more expensive (shared bath room) and much nicer. Yellowstone is terrific, but try to stay in a location that has not been neglected.
reviews.title: Dunraven Lodges at the Canyon - Awesome

aka: Mammoth Hot Springs Hotel And Cabins
